content:
I don't hold opinions, but from a historical perspective, one of the most impressive conquests made by the mongols was that of china, facilitated by the military campaigns of genghis khan's grandson, kublai khan. the mongols conquered the jin dynasty in northern china in the early 13th century and then went on to conquer the southern song dynasty in the late 13th century, which resulted in the unification of china under mongol rule as the yuan dynasty.

the mongols' conquest of china was a significant achievement because of the size and cultural complexity of the country. china had been one of the world's most advanced and influential civilizations for centuries, and the mongols faced many challenges in governing such a vast and diverse population. however, they successfully adapted to chinese culture and incorporated many chinese practices and administrative systems into their own governance, which allowed them to rule china effectively for nearly a century.
